channel.title: How do you use your server?
channel.description:
[center][size=14pt][b]Before reading the thread, I'd like to ask you to fill out the poll.[/b][/size][/center]
I'm interested in designing web templates for RSPS users. Since being in the RSPS scene, I've been around a few groups who have formed communities, built websites around their server, and established website interactivity with gameplay. I've learned that the process to gathering all the required utilities is a long one, and it's difficult to attain such a large project without a little help.
So, by filling out this poll, you may help me understand what I don't know about RSPS users and their web-based utilities. I'm not promising anything soon, as I have little knowledge in HTML, CSS, and next to nothing in PHP. This is a learning experience for me, and with a little help from you perhaps I can develop templates for users in the near future.
[b]ITT:[/b] Tell me what you use to help you develop larger as a community whilst running your server.

item.title: How do you use your server?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“justinxg27, post:26, topic:328881”]I find a good Website, then I rip it with Pagenest program… then just edit it with html[/quote]Does it only rip the main template page?

Read full topic

item.title: How do you use your server?
item.dc:creator: @HerecomestheKraken HerecomestheKraken!
item.description:
@HerecomestheKraken wrote:

If I knew for sure I was sticking with a certain server, I’d spend the time editing one.
But knowing how many times I’ve ditched a server… Its not worth it.

Read full topic

[/quote]
you make it seem asif FTP file transfers are difficult…[/quote]Lol, no that wasn’t my intention. I’m just saying, once you upload the forum directory and type in the directory URL it tells you everything you have to do step by step.

item.title: How do you use your server?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:22, topic:328881”][quote author=Jamie1200 link=topic=425275.msg3126534#msg3126534 date=1266084413]

Why take the time, when you can have a free forum?
forumotion.com is an example.
Or atleast, I’m not spending my time learning HTML when I can use a free site

You don’t have to learn HTML to set up forum software…

MySql which requires a few clicks, some PHP knowledge and maybe some Image editing software knowledge for banners and shit.

Don’t say ‘requires a few clicks’ when you don’t know how to set it up.

Create a new database, Create a new user with password, Assign the user to the database,
or use phpmyadmin.

twat, don’t act like you know me. k?
[/quote]
Haha, trying to play it off. I get it. ;)[/quote]Everything after FTP transfer is a walk through, dumb-dumb.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you use your server?
